dt.t: … so {wi}nervous{/wi} that he had to be escorted outside court to vomit …

dt: {bc}originating in or affected by the nerves

dt.t: His face was twisted in {wi}nervous{/wi} anticipation.

dt: {bc}appearing or acting unsteady, erratic, or irregular
{bc}marked by strength of thought, feeling, or style {bc}{sx|spirited||}

dt.t: a vibrant tight-packed {wi}nervous{/wi} style of writing

pt: {sc}vigorous{/sc} {sc}energetic{/sc} {sc}strenuous{/sc} {sc}lusty{/sc} {sc}nervous{/sc} mean having or showing great vitality and force. {sc}vigorous{/sc} further implies showing no signs of depletion or diminishing of freshness or robustness.

pt.t: as {it}vigorous{/it} as a youth half his age

pt: {sc}energetic{/sc} suggests a capacity for intense activity.
{sc}strenuous{/sc} suggests a preference for coping with the arduous or the challenging.

pt.t: the {it}strenuous{/it} life on an oil rig

pt: {sc}lusty{/sc} implies exuberant energy and capacity for enjoyment.
{sc}nervous{/sc} suggests especially the forcibleness and sustained effectiveness resulting from mental vigor.

et: Middle English, borrowed from Anglo-French & Latin; Anglo-French {it}nervus, nervous,{/it} borrowed from Latin {it}nervōsus{/it} "full of tendons, sinewy, tough, vigorous (of a person or literary style)," from {it}nervus{/it} "sinew, muscle, {et_link|nerve:1|nerve:1}" + {it}-ōsus{/it} {et_link|-ous|-ous}
shortdef: of or relating to the nerves; also : originating in or affected by the nerves

dt: {bc}an attack of mental or emotional disorder especially when of sufficient severity to require hospitalization

shortdef: an attack of mental or emotional disorder especially when of sufficient severity to require hospitalization

dt: {bc}the bodily system that in vertebrates is made up of the brain and spinal cord, nerves, ganglia, and parts of the receptor organs and that receives and interprets stimuli and transmits impulses to the effector organs {dx}see {dxt|autonomic nervous system||}, {dxt|central nervous system||}, {dxt|peripheral nervous system||}{/dx}

shortdef: the bodily system that in vertebrates is made up of the brain and spinal cord, nerves, ganglia, and parts of the receptor organs and that receives and interprets stimuli and transmits impulses to the effector organs

dt.t: I have a lot of {it}nervous energy{/it}.

dt: {bc}a person who is very worried or nervous about something

dt.t: Before the wedding the bride's father was a {it}nervous wreck{/it}.

shortdef: a person who is very worried or nervous about something

dt: {bc}a part of the vertebrate nervous system that innervates smooth and cardiac muscle and glandular tissues and governs involuntary actions (such as secretion and peristalsis) and that consists of the sympathetic nervous system and the parasympathetic nervous system

shortdef: a part of the vertebrate nervous system that innervates smooth and cardiac muscle and glandular tissues and governs involuntary actions (such as secretion and peristalsis) and that consists of the sympathetic nervous system and the parasympathetic nervous system

dt: {bc}the part of the nervous system which in vertebrates consists of the brain and spinal cord, to which sensory impulses are transmitted and from which motor impulses pass out, and which coordinates the activity of the entire nervous system {dx}compare {dxt|peripheral nervous system||}{/dx}

shortdef: the part of the nervous system which in vertebrates consists of the brain and spinal cord, to which sensory impulses are transmitted and from which motor impulses pass out, and which coordinates the activity of the entire nervous system

dt: {bc}the part of the autonomic nervous system that contains chiefly cholinergic fibers, that tends to induce secretion, to increase the tone and contractility of smooth muscle, and to slow heart rate, and that consists of a cranial and a sacral part {dx}compare {dxt|sympathetic nervous system||}{/dx}

shortdef: the part of the autonomic nervous system that contains chiefly cholinergic fibers, that tends to induce secretion, to increase the tone and contractility of smooth muscle, and to slow heart rate, and that consists of a cranial and a sacral part

dt: {bc}the part of the nervous system that is outside the central nervous system and comprises the cranial nerves excepting the optic nerve, the spinal nerves, and the autonomic nervous system

shortdef: the part of the nervous system that is outside the central nervous system and comprises the cranial nerves excepting the optic nerve, the spinal nerves, and the autonomic nervous system
